content: That's a good question. "Blood Meridian" is a critically acclaimed novel by Cormac McCarthy, and while it may not be as widely known as some other works of popular culture, it has certainly gained a significant following since its publication. As for the topic of Gnosticism, while it may not be as well-known as some other religious or philosophical movements, it has had a significant influence on many cultural and literary works throughout history. So it could be considered a topic that straddles the boundary between popular culture and more esoteric subjects. Ultimately, it depends on how you define "popular culture."
